sn39.1:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Vajjians near Ukkacelā on the bank of the Ganges river.
sn39.1:4.2: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍaka went up to Venerable Sāriputta
sn39.1:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn39.1:5.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘extinguishment’.
sn39.1:5.3: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion
sn39.1:5.5: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this extinguishment?”
sn39.1:6.2: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn39.1:6.3: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn39.1:6.5: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this extinguishment.”
sn39.1:6.6: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this extinguishment.
sn39.1:6.7: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”
sn39.1:8.1: (These should be expanded in the same way as the Linked Discourses with Jambukhādaka.)
